questionsData.title: Bicarbonate of soda and calcium hydroxide are acids.
Rough surfaces reflect light.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The anwser is True.

Rough reflects the light but less than smooth one.

questionsData.title: Diseases are the end result of infection by germs.
In the sun's eclipse, the moon moves between earth and sun.
"Laying on the beach" means "staying in horizontal position".
Spaceship is the ship that sails in seas.
To discover is to find out about something.
"Pa" means "for the year".
questionsData.explain_answer:
"Pa" => per annum =  for each year = for the year .

Example : My present salary is 15,000 per annum.

questionsData.title: When writing a letter , the layout of it should be incorrect.
Eskimos are people who live in the Arctic.
Bow and stern are parts of the ship.
Voyage is the journey on land.
questionsData.explain_answer:
False. A voyage is a journey by sea or air, not by land.

Here's why:

  • Voyage typically refers to a long journey, often by water.
  • Land journeys are usually referred to with words like trip or journey.

questionsData.title: The text is mainly talking about ………….
questionsData.article: A pandemic is an epidemic that has spread to several countries or continents, becoming a global health emergency. An epidemic can develop into a pandemic very quickly. Just like coronavirus (covid-19) nowadays which is an infectious disease that is caused by SARS – (Covid-2 virus). (It 3) spread in the whole world and caused and still causing unlimited panic all over the world. In 2003, the SARS (Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome) virus spread from China to 37 countries around the world in just a few weeks. The avian flu (birds’ flu) has caused a pandemic in recent years. In 2009, a new type of flu virus started in Mexico and spread to 70 countries. A month later, the number of countries nearly (doubled 1). A pandemic is not the same as a plague which is a disease that spreads quickly and kills many people. A pandemic can kill many people, but it doesn’t always. However, a pandemic is a very (serious 2) international health emergency.
